title: RL31654
content: The Endangered Species Act (ESA) provides legal protection to identified species and their habitats, administered by the Fish and Wildlife Service (FWS) and the National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS). Species can be listed as "endangered" or "threatened" based on extinction risk assessments. Legal tools under the ESA include prohibiting unpermitted "take" of endangered species and ensuring actions do not harm listed species. The Endangered Species Act (ESA) requires agencies to ensure their actions do not harm listed species or critical habitat.
